intro: Oldenlandia thesiifolia, commonly known as the "Mexican spiderwort," is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the southern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that are typically white or pink, arranged in clusters along the stems. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas or near streams. The leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
